input: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : User Behavior Class Breakdown by Device Model.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Get the count of each User Behavior Class for each Device Model
behavior_breakdown = df.groupby(['Device Model', 'User Behavior Class']).size().unstack()

# Create the plot
behavior_breakdown.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10,6), stacked=True)

# Show the plot
plt.show()
'''

input: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : App Usage Time Distribution by User Behavior Class.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group by 'User Behavior Class' and plot the distribution of 'App Usage Time (min/day)'
df.groupby('User Behavior Class')['App Usage Time (min/day)'].plot(kind='box')
plt.title('App Usage Time Distribution by User Behavior Class')
plt.xlabel('User Behavior Class')
plt.ylabel('App Usage Time (min/day)')
plt.show()
'''

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

plt.title('Operating System vs Screen On Time')

output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

device_models = df['Device Model'].unique()
battery_drainmeans = []

for model in device_models:
    battery_drainmeans.append(df[df['Device Model'] == model]['Battery Drain (mAh/day)'].mean())

plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.bar(device_models, battery_drainmeans)
plt.xlabel('Device Model')
plt.ylabel('Average Battery Drain (mAh/day)')
plt.title('Device Model vs Battery Drain')
plt.xticks(rotation=90)
plt.show()
'''

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Calculate user engagement scores
df['User Engagement Score'] = df['App Usage Time (min/day)'] + df['Screen On Time (hours/day)'] * 60

# Create a histogram of user engagement scores
plt.hist(df['User Engagement Score'], bins=10, edgecolor='black')
plt.xlabel('User Engagement Score')
plt.ylabel('Number of Users')
plt.title('Distribution of User Engagement Scores')
plt.show()
'''

input: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : Age vs Battery Drain.
output:
'''
python
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Create a scatter plot of Age vs Battery Drain
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.scatter(df['Age'], df['Battery Drain (mAh/day)'])
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.ylabel('Battery Drain (mAh/day)')
plt.title('Age vs Battery Drain')
plt.show()
'''

input: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : User Behavior Class vs Gender.
output:
'''
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
data = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Count the number of males and females in each User Behavior Class
behavior_class_gender = data.groupby(['User Behavior Class', 'Gender']).size().reset_index(name='Count')

# Pivot the data to create a table with User Behavior Class as index, Gender as columns, and Count as values
pivot_table = behavior_class_gender.pivot(index='User Behavior Class', columns='Gender', values='Count')

# Plot the data
pivot_table.plot(kind='bar', figsize=(10, 6))
plt.title('User Behavior Class vs Gender')
plt.xlabel('User Behavior Class')
plt.ylabel('Count')
plt.legend(title='Gender')
plt.show()
'''

input: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : Data Usage by User Behavior Class.
output:
'''
python
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by 'User Behavior Class' and calculate the mean of 'Data Usage (MB/day)'
data_usage_by_class = df.groupby('User Behavior Class')['Data Usage (MB/day)'].mean()

# Create a bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
data_usage_by_class.plot(kind='bar')
plt.title('Data Usage by User Behavior Class')
plt.xlabel('User Behavior Class')
plt.ylabel('Data Usage (MB/day)')
plt.show()
'''

input: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : Operating System vs App Usage.
output:
'''
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset
df = pd.read_csv('dataset.csv')

# Group the data by Operating System and calculate the mean App Usage Time
os_app_usage = df.groupby('Operating System')['App Usage Time (min/day)'].mean()

# Create a bar chart
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
os_app_usage.plot(kind='bar')
plt.title('Operating System vs App Usage Time')
plt.xlabel('Operating System')
plt.ylabel('Mean App Usage Time (min/day)')
plt.show()
'''

input: A dataset contains these columns: ['User ID', 'Device Model', 'Operating System', 'App Usage Time (min/day)', 'Screen On Time (hours/day)', 'Battery Drain (mAh/day)', 'Number of Apps Installed', 'Data Usage (MB/day)', 'Age', 'Gender', 'User Behavior Class']                     python code to do the following : Gender vs Data Usage.

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Load the dataset

# Group the data by Gender and calculate the mean Data Usage
gender_data_usage = df.groupby('Gender')['Data Usage (MB/day)'].mean()

gender_data_usage.plot(kind='bar')
plt.title('Gender vs Data Usage')
plt.xlabel('Gender')
plt.ylabel('Mean Data Usage (MB/day)')
plt.show()
